jx.jx_en_mean: used to convey that something is obvious

lj.lj_ly: there's no prizes for guessing what you two have been up to!.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: the noun, a variant of price; the verb (originally in the sense 'estimate the value of') from Old French pris-, stem of preisier 'to praise, appraise' (see praise)

entry.def: A prize is money or something valuable that is given to someone who has the best results in a competition or game, or as a reward for doing good work.

example.ex: You must claim your prize by telephoning our claims line...
example.tran: 您必须通过拨打我们的领奖电话来领取奖品。

example.ex: He won first prize at the Leeds Piano Competition...
example.tran: 他在利兹国际钢琴比赛中荣获一等奖。

entry.def: You use prize to describe things that are of such good quality that they win prizes or deserve to win prizes.

entry.tran: 非常珍贵的人（或物）；十分重要的人（或物）
entry.def: You can refer to someone or something as a prize when people consider them to be of great value or importance.

example.ex: With no lands of his own, he was no great matrimonial prize.
example.tran: 他没有自己的地产，不是结婚的上佳人选。

entry.def: Something that is prized is wanted and admired because it is considered to be very valuable or very good quality.

example.ex: Military figures, made out of lead are prized by collectors...
example.tran: 收藏家们对铅铸的军人塑像视若珍宝。

example.ex: One of the gallery's most prized possessions is the portrait of Ginevra de'Benci.
example.tran: 这个美术馆最珍贵的藏品之一是达芬奇的《女子肖像》。

entry.def: If you prize something open or prize it away from a surface, you force it to open or force it to come away from the surface.

example.ex: He tried to prize the dog's mouth open...
example.tran: 他试图把这条狗的嘴掰开。

example.ex: I prised off the metal rim surrounding one of the dials...
example.tran: 我把其中一个刻度盘的金属边撬开了。

entry.tran: 竭力打探（消息等）；说服…透露（消息）
entry.def: If you prize something such as information out of someone, you persuade them to tell you although they may be very unwilling to.

example.ex: Alison and I had to prize conversation out of him.
example.tran: 我和艾莉森只得从他口中撬出谈话内容。

means.word_mean: 1. something given for victory or superiority in a contest or competition or for winning a lottery;

sentences.sentence: "the prize was a free trip to Europe"

means.word_mean: 3. something given as a token of victory
2. to move or force, especially in an effort to get something open;

sentences.sentence: "The burglar jimmied the lock", "Raccoons managed to pry the lid off the garbage pail"
